pages.title: ℧ Ace of Cups ℧
pages.text: Root of the Powers of Water$(br)    Natural Receptive Vigor

The waters are beneath, and thereon are water-lilies; the hand issues from the cloud, holding in its palm the cup, from which streams are pouring; the dew of water is falling on all sides.$(br)  Cups represent love, imagination, intuition, fantasies, the unconscious - all things associated with Water. These associations do not come just from arbitrary choice.$(br)  The pouring streams suggest overflowing abundance and

remind us of the legends of the Holy Grail and of the Goddess's Cauldron of Plenty; symbols of divine, unconditional love and limitless gifts.$(br)  Water is deep and dark, like the unconscious. It flows, and it is formless, taking on the shape of whatever is holding it.$(br)  The imagination too is a shape changer, inspired by the world of the senses.$(br)  Like love, Water is shimmering and beautiful, but

dangerous.$(br)  The element of Water does not make strict separations.$(br)  Feelings flow from one state to another; we sense our connections with the world around us and with other people.$(br)  We learn to merge with others, in acceptance, in sharing, in passion, and in love.$(br2)$(l)Divinatory meanings$()$(br)  Love, great happiness, powerful emotions, a time of

life being very good to us.$(br)  Abundance and fertility.$(br2)$(l)Reversed$()$(br)  The emotions remain strong, but troubled.$(br)  Sadness. The need to work at a relationship.$(br)  Instability, revolution.
